intro: Phacelia bifurca, commonly known as the twin-branch phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value. Phacelia bifurca is also an important nectar source for bees and other pollinators.
